measure: Journeys to China are discouraged
Returning travellers from China and other affected regions shall contact a doctor in case of symptoms (within 14 days of return)
First case tested positive
Prohibition of events with more than 1000 participants (following federal decision)
cantonal COVID19 hotline is opened
Population is advised to wash hands, follow sneezing etiquette and avoid touching door knobs follow
Persons showing respiratory symptoms shall stay at home and contact a doctor (but not go to doctor's office)
Social distancing is encouraged
Prohibition of events with more than 100 persons unless attendents are seated with sufficient social distance. Such events need to be announced to the cantonal physician who can cancel them.
Persons from outside risk groups are discouraged from contacting doctors and hospitals unless health status is severe.
Persons showing fever, or cough (as with a cold) shall stay at home until resolution of symptoms, contact doctor only if in risk group
Cantonal debt collection office closed for the general public
Population is encouraged to avoid in-person visits to counters of the cantonal administration
Extracurricular activities in schools on Wednesdays are canceled
Cantonal employment office closed
Prohibition of events with more than 100 participants (following federal decision)
Restaurants and bars can no longer accommodate more than 50 guests
Isolated facilities to receive persons showing respiratory symptoms and having stayed in risk zones are established in the University Hospital
Special units to take care of COVID patients are crated at the University Hospital
Preparations to increase ICU capacities are under way
Non-essential hospital visits are prohibited
Driving exams are canceled
Schools closed (following federal decision)
Universities closed (following federal decision)
Daycare facilities closed (following federal decision)
Office de l'urbanisme is closed
Office cantonal des véhicules closed
Bars, restaurants and clubs are closed
Closure of non-essential businesses
Closure of all public entertainment businesses (cinemas, theatres etc)
All economic activity with close body contact (e.g. hairdressers) is prohibited
Prohibition of gatherings with more than 5 persons
Employees of the public administration with non-essential tasks have to stay at home
Bureau de l'intégration des étrangers closed
Bureau de médiation administrative closed for the public
Mouettes genevoises boats stop circulating
Administration fiscale cantonale closed for the public
Office cantonal de la population et des migrations closed

Direction générale de l'office cantonal de l'inspection et des relations du travail
 suspends all open procedures
Prohibition of all visits to hospitals, other health care facilities and homes for disabled persons
Office des autorisations de construire closed for the public
Procesing of work permits is suspended
All construction sites closed
All police stations except for two closed for the public
University Hospital chosen to accommodate all COVID19 patients in the canton
All but eight customs posts closed
Office de l'action, de l'insertion et de l'intégration sociales closed for the public, with exception of service de protection de l'adulte
Following federal decision, re-opening of construction sites can be demanded if safety requirements are met
Members of risk groups are discouraged from making payments in person at the bank counter and shall use other forms of payment instead.
University Hospital receives two COVID19 patients from the hospital of Mulhouse
Service de la consommation et des affaires vétérinaires closed
Hotline CoviCall to consult symptomatic persons on further steps
Mobile teams to test symptomatic persons at home
CoviCheck service to contact, accompany and instruct persons with positive test result by phone, including instructions on self-quarantine of entourage
Network CoviCare to coordinate outpatient care for symptomatic persons

Service des prestations complémentaires du 
Département de la cohésion sociale (DCS) closed for the public, deadlines are postponed
